arm_group.description: Implantation with a Bone Anchored Hearing Aid

brief_summary.textblock:
The Bonebridge is a new bone conducting implantable hearing aid. The investigators plan to
      randomize patients to receive either the Bonebridge or a conventional bone conducting
      hearing device. The investigators will then compare the surgical and audiological outcomes
      of the two groups.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Randomised Controlled Trial Comparing Bone Anchored Hearing Aid With Bonebridge

detailed_description.textblock:
The new Bonebridge fully implanted, except for an external sound processor. It does not have
      any percutaneous parts like the Bone Anchored Hearing Aid. The investigators believe that
      this may improve wound healing and reduce problems with wound infection and skin overgrowth
      seen in Bone Anchored Hearing Aids.

      There may also be audiological improvements by the use of the Bonebridge as the physical
      separation of the vibrating part from the sound processor should reduce feedback. The
      company also claims other audiological improvements in the Bonebridge.

      The investigators wish to demonstrate whether this is actually the case by performing a
      study directly comparing the outcomes of the two groups.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Conductive Hearing Loss within criteria for Bonebridge

          -  Adults

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Children

          -  Pregnancy

keyword: bone conduction thresholds better than 45 dBHL
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomised Controlled Trial Comparing Bone Anchored Hearing Aid With Bonebridge

primary_outcome.description: We will record and compare the standard speech audiometry results at a specific sound level in order to make a direct comparison of devices
primary_outcome.measure: Speech audiogram result at 6 months after switch on at 60 dBA in quiet using AB word lists

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: The speech audiogram will also be carried out in noise to demonstrate whether one device gives an appreciable advantage over another with respect to understanding in noise compared to silence.
secondary_outcome.measure: Speech audiogram result at 60 dB A in noise using AB word lists

secondary_outcome.description: Patients will be asked to complete the Glasgow Benefit Inventory (GBI) and Hearing Device Satisfaction Scale (HDSS) questionnaires
The time (measured in days) will be recorded from the date of implantation to the date of its switch-on.
secondary_outcome.measure: Time from surgery to device switch-on
Number of patient episodes required during study period

secondary_outcome.description: Measured in days, as judged subjectively by ENT medical and nursing staff

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment
